definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)

sentences.english: The largest and most widespread heron in North America.
sentences.chinese: 這種蒼鷺在北美分佈最廣，而且個頭最大。

sentences.english: One day a squawky Bird with a broken wing arrives in the yard.
sentences.chinese: 一天，一隻斷了翅膀的蒼鷺來到了院子裏。

sentences.english: The heron is one of the UK's largest native birds and grey herons are also common around garden ponds.
sentences.chinese: 鷺是英國最大本土鳥類之一，蒼鷺也經常出現在池塘。

sentences.english: I am practicing to walk like a heron.
A heron swoops overhead, looking for its next meal.
sentences.chinese: 一隻蒼鷺在頭上飛過，正在尋找食物。

sentences.english: The place is also inhabited by herons.

sentences.chinese: 蒼鷺是一家時髦的公寓。

sentences.english: The river is also home to a heron rookery and various other types of wild life.
sentences.chinese: 這條河也是蒼鷺和其它各種各樣野生動物的棲息地。

sentences.english: A heron at a flooded ecology park in Seoul.
sentences.chinese: 洪水過後的生態公園的蒼鷺。

sentences.english: I managed to make two photos of this and the bird flew away with the rabbit in its bill.
sentences.chinese: 我抓拍了兩張之後蒼鷺就飛走了，兔子還含在它嘴裏。

sentences.english: Photo of a heron with its shadow on her wing.
sentences.chinese: 這是一張帶有翅膀影子的蒼鷺照片。

definition: to cut off/to interrupt/to prevent access
to cross (a road, an ocean etc)/to cut across
clear as ice and clean as jade (idiom); spotless/irreproachable/incorruptible
Garden of Many Flowers (name)/Baihua garden in Hongmiao village 洪廟村|洪庙村[Hong2 miao4 cun1], Shandong
(bird species of China) red-crowned crane (Grus japonensis)
to move about/to go from place to place/roving/mobile
insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
